alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Dewey; Ellis; Greer; Harmon; Harper; Roger Mills; Washita; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 14 at 2:23AM CST until February 15 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Windy, warm, and dry conditions expected Tuesday... .An approaching strong upper level storm system will result in a area of surface low pressure developing in the lee of the Rockies throughout Tuesday. Strong south winds will quickly develop Tuesday morning and continue through Tuesday night. Very warm temperatures and dry air across portions of western Oklahoma will combine with these winds to produce near critical to critical fire weather conditions during the afternoon and early evening hours. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR strong winds... warm temperatures and low relative humidity FOR western Oklahoma... * TIMING...Tuesday afternoon and evening. * WINDS...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start will be difficult to contain.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
